meanings.definition: Dull, gloomy, or lifeless in appearance or atmosphere.
meanings.sent1: The drear weather made everyone feel down.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a drear look to it.
meanings.sent3: The party was so drear that even the balloons seemed sad.
meanings.sent4: Her face wore a drear expression, mirroring the gray sky above.
meanings.sent5: The drear landscape stretched out before us, devoid of color or life.

meanings.definition: To make someone feel sad or bored.
meanings.sent1: His monotonous speech dreared the audience to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The long lecture dreared the students in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The movie's plot twist dreared the viewers in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending wait at the doctor's office dreared me to tears.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tasks drear me out, draining all my energy.
